document_data.name: Pol
document_data.mainbody:
'''Pol''' was the beloved Chief Houndmaster of the [[Durinbold]] [[patriar]] family of [[Baldur's Gate]], who died sometime in or before the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Here lies the Houndmaster of the Durinbolds, surrounded by his loyal pack, good boys and girls all.''|Plaque in the [[Durinbold Mausoleum]].}}
document_data.Description: In life, Pol had long wavy hair and wore a trimmed beard.
document_data.Possessions:
He used a [[crossbow]] in battle, in life and as a [[ghost]].

Pol's sarcophagus held a magic [[scroll]] of the ''[[animal friendship]]'' [[spell]] and a ''[[potion of animal speaking]]''.
document_data.History: By the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Chief Houndmaster Pol was long dead and interred within the Durinbold Mausoleum of the [[Lower City Graveyard]], surrounded by the interred bodies of his favorite beasts, [[Gordis]], [[Rocky]], and [[Zina]]. The trainer and his three [[dog]]s were ghosts that would attack anyone who dared to invade and disturb the Durinbold family tombs.
